intro: Blephariglottis × channellii, commonly known as the hybrid kōhanga, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive foliage. Due to its limited natural range, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
